degree_multipliers.rationale: Civic activists and campaigners meet many people through organizing, canvassing, and community events, making them major social hubs.
Self-employed individuals maintain broad professional networks across clients, vendors, and business contacts.
Managers and professionals have larger workplace networks and attend conferences, industry events, and community boards.
Highly extraverted individuals actively seek out social connections and maintain larger social networks.
Heavy social media users accumulate more online connections and follower relationships.
Married individuals expand their social network through their spouse's family, friends, and community ties.
Very frequent religious attendees are deeply embedded in their congregation's social network, connecting with many fellow members.

edge_type_rules.name: household_member
edge_type_rules.description: Members of the same household — spouses, domestic partners, or cohabitating adults sharing a home.

edge_type_rules.name: political_community
edge_type_rules.condition: a_state == b_state and a_political_affiliation == b_political_affiliation and a_civic_engagement == b_civic_engagement
edge_type_rules.description: People in the same state who share political affiliation and civic engagement patterns — likely connected through local party organizations, campaigns, or activist groups.

edge_type_rules.name: faith_community
edge_type_rules.condition: a_religious_affiliation == b_religious_affiliation and a_state == b_state and a_religious_attendance != "Never"
edge_type_rules.description: Members of the same religious community in the same state who attend services, forming bonds through shared worship and congregation activities.

edge_type_rules.name: neighbor_acquaintance
edge_type_rules.description: People living in the same state and same type of community (urban/suburban/rural), representing neighborhood ties, local events, and community interactions.

edge_type_rules.name: online_connection
edge_type_rules.description: People who use the same social media platform and consume news from the same ideological lean — connected through online communities, shared groups, and algorithmic feeds.

influence_factors.description: Higher education is associated with greater perceived expertise and credibility on policy issues; people are more likely to defer to the opinions of more educated peers.

influence_factors.levels: {"Rarely/Never votes": 1, "Votes sometimes": 2, "Votes regularly": 3, "Actively volunteers or campaigns": 4}
influence_factors.description: Actively engaged citizens are seen as more politically informed and authoritative; they invest more effort in persuasion and are treated as opinion leaders within their networks.
Higher income confers social status and perceived life success, giving wealthier individuals slightly more influence in mixed-income social circles.
Older adults are generally perceived as having more life experience and are granted greater deference on civic and policy matters, particularly within family and community contexts.
